Subject: About the new scenario editor

MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1

X-Mailer: eGroups Message Poster
From: "Daniel Paul Hightower" <dph_of_rules@...>

1st, rather than having 3-4 people working on their own scenario 
editor, I would propose that this is a GROUP project.

For those of you who think I have no programming experience, 
http://www.cei.net/~dphofrules/prog .  I transformed on my own an 
Othello program in QBasic without subroutines into a very workable and 
easily expandable program.  I was working on a program to use Visual 
Basic as a GUI and C as my intelligence for Othello, but my old PC 
couldn't support it and my copy of Visual Studio on CD has bad files 
on it.  I am currently working on acquiring all of Visual Studio to 
install on this PC so I can complete a program I started.  

The easiest way to make a new scenario mouse-oriented would be use 
Visual Basic or Visual C/C++, IMHO.

I would like a show of hands of those who would like to work on a 
scenario editor.  Please include some hints of qualifications.
